title: Did Joseph Stalin murder his own family members? - Quora

response.answer_text: died History & Literature at Russian State University for the Humanities Did Joseph Stalin really imprison his own family? Yes, he did. Stalin didn’t imprison any of his blood relatives, but the close relatives of both of his late wives were repressed, as well as people connected to his children.Alexander Svanidze, the brother of Stalin’s first wife, and his wife Maria were executed in the early 1940s, for spying. Alexander’s sister was shot along with them.Pavel Alliluyev, the brother of Stalin’s second wife, died under mysterious circumstances in 1938, while his sister, his daughter, his widow, and her second husband were arrested and imprisoned for his poisoning and anti-Soviet activities in the late 1940s. All of them survived imprisonment.Joseph Morozov, the father of the first husband of Stalin’s daughter Svetlana, was imprisoned in 1948 until Stalin’s death. Allegedly, he tried to exploit his connection to Stalin for financial gain. After his arrest, Svetlana was involuntarily divorced.Also, Yulia Meltzer, the wife of Stalin’s elder son Jacob, was imprisoned when Jacob was taken prisoner by the Germans in 1941. She was accused of encouraging her husband to surrender without a fight. Yulia was released when Jacob was killed in a POW camp a year and a half later. 130 views · Answer requested by Don Pinero  Add Comment  Boris Ivanov ·
